1.brief: to fondle; by implication, to love, especially to compassionate
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

2.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)
a net, or (abstractly) capture; also a fastness
to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile
a horn (as projecting); by implication, a flask, cornet; by resemblance. an elephant's tooth (i.e. ivory), a corner (of the altar), a peak (of a mountain), a ray (of light); figuratively, power
defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab, a place in Moab

3.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

4.brief: a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
without profit, worthlessness; by extension, destruction, wickedness

5.brief: a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
to project (one self), i.e. precede; hence, to anticipate, hasten, meet (usually for help)
a noose (for catching animals) (literally or figuratively); by implication, a hook (for the nose)
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin

6.brief: narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, to be free; but used only causatively and reflexively, to halloo (for help, i.e. freedom from some trouble)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a large public building, such as a palace or temple
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)

7.brief: to undulate (as the earth, the sky, etc.; also a field of grain), particularly through fear; specifically, to spring (as a locust)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
to quiver (with any violent emotion, especially anger or fear)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to glow or grow warm; figuratively (usually) to blaze up, of anger, zeal, jealousy

8.brief: to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
smoke, literally or figuratively (vapor, dust, anger)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

9.brief: to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

10.brief: to ride (on an animal or in a vehicle); causatively, to place upon (for riding or generally), to despatch
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to fly; also (by implication of dimness) to faint (from the darkness of swooning)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)

the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
a cover (in a good or a bad, a literal or a figurative sense)
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse
a powder (as beaten small); by analogy, a thin vapor; by extension, the firmament

properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)

13.brief: to tumble, i.e. be violently agitated; specifically, to crash (of thunder); figuratively, to irritate (with anger)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)

properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
to dash in pieces, literally or figuratively (especially to disperse)
lightning; by analogy, a gleam; concretely, a flashing sword
properly, to put in commotion; by implication, to disturb, drive, destroy

properly, containing, i.e. a tube; also a bed or valley of astream; also a strong thing or a hero
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
the earth (as moist and therefore inhabited); by extension, the globe; by implication, its inhabitants; specifically, a particular land, as Babylonia, Palestine
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a puff, i.e. wind, angry or vital breath, divine inspiration, intellect. or (concretely) an animal

abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
